name: Mission Neighborhood Health Center
description: Founded since 2002, the Mission Neighborhood Resource Center (MNRC) advocates for housing and resources to enhance the physical, social, emotional and economic health of homeless residents in the 16th street corridor and surrounding Mission neighborhood. MNRC offers services that are bilingual, free of charge and available on a drop-in basis. For the most up-to-date information about their services, call the MNRC Resource Center at (415) 869-7977.
